description: From Ancient Greek πτερόν (pterón, “wing, feather”) + ποδός (podós), genitive singular of πούς (poús, “foot, leg”). Equivalent to ptero- +‎ -pod.

entries.meaning: Any of free-swimming pelagic sea snails and sea slugs, of the suborder Thecosomata, that have winglike lobes on the feet; a sea butterfly.
examples: Pteropods, also known as sea butterflies, are marine gastropods adapted to pelagic life. […] When pteropods constitute a high percentage of the ooze the deposit is called pteropod ooze.
